greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of (1-x^3)/((1-x)*(1+2*x^2)).
comment: Consider the autosequence (that is a sequence whose inverse binomial transform is equal to the signed sequence) of the first kind of the example. Its numerator is A046978(n), its denominator is b(n). The numerator of the first column is A075553(n).
The denominator corresponding to the 0's is a choice.
link: Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (0,-2).
mathematica: CoefficientList[Series[(1-x^3)/((1-x)(1+2 x^2)),{x,0,40}],x] (* or *) LinearRecurrence[{0,-2},{1,1,-1},45] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Apr 09 2018 *)
results.author: _Paul Barry_, Mar 29 2006
